solution_line_template: If the box has four dozen bottles of water, there are {num_dozen_bottles}*{dozen} = <<{num_dozen_bottles}*{dozen}={initial_bottles}>>{initial_bottles} bottles of water in the box

After the first half, the {num_players} players take {num_players}*{bottles_per_player_first_break} = <<{num_players}*{bottles_per_player_first_break}={bottles_taken_first_break}>>{bottles_taken_first_break} bottles of water from the box.
If they take {num_players} more bottles of water at the end of the game, the number increases to {bottles_taken_first_break}+{num_players} = {total_bottles_taken} bottles of water taken
Without the bottles taken, there are {initial_bottles}-{total_bottles_taken} =<<{initial_bottles}-{total_bottles_taken}={remaining_bottles}>>{remaining_bottles} bottles of water remaining in the box
